channel.title: STA 360/602L: SUMMER I 2021
channel.description: Recent content on STA 360/602L: SUMMER I 2021

item.description: Note: *Please check this page frequently for updates and always remember to refresh the page.* Week Date Lesson Reading Video Slides Slides (pdf) Lab Problem Sets Module 0.1: Course overview WEEK 1 MODULE 1: INTRODUCTION TO BAYESIAN INFERENCE Wed, May 12 Module 1.

item.title: Policies
item.description: When in doubt about anything at all, ask questions!!! Prerequisites ALL students are expected to be familiar with all the topics covered within the required prerequisites to be in this course. That is, STA 611 or the following: STA 210 and (STA 230 or 240L) and (MATH 202, 202D, 212, or 222) and (MATH 216, 218, or 221, any of which may be taken concurrently). Students are also expected to be very familiar with R and are encouraged to have learned LaTeX or a Markdown language by the end of the course.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Supplementary Textbooks These textbooks are great resources for some of the topics we will cover. You do not need to buy them, but you may be able to borrow them from Duke library should you need extra reading materials, besides the class slides and main textbooks. Doing Bayesian Data Analysis in brms and the tidyverse Statistical rethinking with brms, ggplot2, and the tidyverse: Second edition Albert, J. (2009), "Bayesian Computation with R (Second Edition).
